curam.util.deferredprocessing.impl
Interface DPCallback

public interface DPCallback

Interface definition for application-defined deferred processing callback methods.

See the Curam Workflow Management System Developers Guide for more details.

Method Summary
 void dpHandleError(java.lang.String processName, long instanceDataID)
          Gives application developers control over error handling when the invocation of a deferred process fails.
 

Method Detail

dpHandleError

void dpHandleError(java.lang.String processName,
                   long instanceDataID)
                   throws AppException,
                          InformationalException
Gives application developers control over error handling when the invocation of a deferred process fails. This callback is invoked once the deferred processing message has been moved to the DPError queue (usually after the failing process has been retried several times).

Parameters:
processName - The name of the deferred process that failed.
instanceDataID - The unique identifier of the InstanceData table record associated with the deferred process that has failed.
Throws:
AppException - Since this is a callback method, implemented by application developers, it is possible that the application-defined logic may throw an exception. If this occurs, the DP engine will log the error and retry the processing. If the retries do not succeed, the deferred process is halted.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.
